channel.title: Getting Started with Axoloti, the Book
channel.description:
Since the community is very new, and there aren't a lot of resources available to get started with patching, I've decided to write a book about Axoloti.
The book will teach you how to create basic synthesizers, drum machines and audio effects. These are the chapters I've planned. __The first chapter is available as a free sample.__
- Chapter 1: Creating Your First Synthesizer - Chapter 2: Creating a Polyphonic Synthesizer - Chapter 3: Diving into Sound Design - Chapter 4: Creating Drum Machines - Chapter 5: Creating Audio Effects - Chapter 6: Adding Physical Controls
The book will be self-published via Leanpub. Working without a publisher will allow me to keep the book more affordable.
Enough talking for now. Get the book over here: https://leanpub.com/getting-started-with-axoloti/

item.title: Getting Started with Axoloti, the Book
item.dc:creator: @janvantomme Jan Vantomme
item.description:
@janvantomme wrote:

No. But you should not use v2.0 as it's not stable enough. The major concepts in v2.0 are still the same as v1.0.12, so there is currently no need to write a major update to the book.

item.description:
@bpaturzo wrote:

Finally got your book!

The bad news is I still haven’t received the Axoloti board yet.........
The funny thing is I finally received the control board that fits on the Axoloti....
So to summarize I got your book but no Axoloti. I got the control board....but no Axoloti....sigh
Damn you COVID-19

Read full topic
item.source: Getting Started with Axoloti, the Book

item.title: Getting Started with Axoloti, the Book
item.dc:creator: @janvantomme Jan Vantomme
item.description:
@janvantomme wrote:

The book is up to date with 1.0.12. This is also the version you should be using right now since 2.0 is a bit too experimental for daily use.

The only thing missing in the book is embedded subpatches (also known as the patch/patcher object). Earlier versions used external files for this. I'm planning to update this in the next version of the book, but I won't commit to a release date yet. Future updates to the book are free for everyone who bought it.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting Started with Axoloti, the Book
